movies.title: Harlock: Space Pirate
movies.plot: 2977: For many years a mighty battle has been raging across the galaxies as 500 billion humans, whose forebears were exiled from Earth, plan to return to what is still called home. Forced to flee a ravaged Earth, humans have now depleted the corners of the galaxy to which they fled. Earth has now become the most valued and precious resource of all, controlled by the corrupt Gaia Coalition which governs the human race across the different galaxies. Having been exiled and vilified during the battle of the Homecoming War, Captain Harlock and his trusted crew of the Arcadia battle cruiser are the only hope mankind has of discovering the secrets that the Gaia have kept hidden. The Coalition has demanded Harlock's death and the Gaia Fleet's new leader, Ezra, calls on his younger brother, Logan, to infiltrate the Arcadia and then assassinate Harlock, thus forever eradicating the one man standing between the Coalition and their complete control of the Universe. Logan must make a very personal...
movies.simplePlot: Mankind is dying. Only one man can do anything about it, Space Captain Harlock, but the Gaia Coalition will stop at nothing to end him.

biography.bio: Yû Aoi was born on August 17, 1985 in Fukuoka, Japan as Yû Natsui. She is an actress, known for Tekkonkinkreet (2006), Redline (2009) and Hula Girls (2006).
biography.name: Yû Aoi

biography.bio: Based out of Prague, Czech Republic, Jessica is co-CEO of Prague Shakespeare Company the Czech Republic's professional English-language theatre. Her film and TV work includes the upcoming feature films 'Unlocked' directed by Michael Apted, starring Michael Douglas, Orlando Bloom, Noomi Rapace and John Malkovich and 'Puerto Ricans In Paris'. Jessica also appeared on ABC-TV as Rabia in 'Missing' starring Ashley Judd, Sean Bean and Cliff Curtis. She has also been seen on the Internet in Skoda's web series: Meet The Engineer. She is known throughout the anime world for her work voicing hundreds of characters in Japanese animated series such as Hello Kitty, Angelic Layer, High School of the Dead, Azumanga Daioh and Akame ga Kill!. Jessica has also lent her voice to the Spiderwoman web comics and numerous national commercials and campaigns. In 2016 she appeared on tour with Academy-Award nominated composer Patrick Doyle, conductor James Sherman and actor Guy Roberts in Patrick Doyle's Music of Shakespeare in Qatar, Doha and Orlando, Florida; and as Lady Macbeth in Macbeth and Hero in Much Ado About Nothing at the Great Hall of the Historic Library of Alexandria, Egypt. Other recent appearances with PSC include Lady Anne in Richard III at Prague Castle and the Estates Theater, Hermione in The Winter's Tale at the Estates Theater, Vanda in Venus in Fur in Prague at Divadlo Kolowrat and on tour to Budapest, Hungary; Rosalind in As You Like It at the Estates Theater, Katherine / Boy in Henry V, Innogen in Cymbeline, and Fools for Love: Shakespeare's Sonnets. Other PSC favorites are Ophelia in Hamlet, Regan in King Lear and Rosalind in As You Like It at Vysehrad and on tour for the inaugural season of the Krumlov Shakespeare Festival in Ceský Krumlov. Jessica graduated magna cum laude with a BA in Acting and Directing from The University of Houston School of Theatre & Dance, is a recognized actor/combatant by the Society of American Fight Directors and a proud member of Actors' Equity Association and British Equity.
biography.name: Jessica Boone

biography.bio: Ayano Fukuda is an actress, known for Harlock: Space Pirate (2013), Take Five: Oretachi wa ai o nusumeruka (2013) and Kamen Rider Wizard in Magic Land (2013).
biography.name: Ayano Fukuda

biography.bio: Arata Furuta was born on December 3, 1965 in Hyogo, Japan as Takefumi Furuta. He is an actor, known for 13 assassins (2010), Hana (2006) and Apartment 1303 (2007). He is married to Yayoi Nishihaa. They have one child.
biography.name: Arata Furuta

biography.bio: Adam Gibbs is an actor, known for Grave of the Fireflies (1988), Starship Troopers: Invasion (2012) and Harlock: Space Pirate (2013).
biography.name: Adam Gibbs

biography.bio: Kiyoshi Kobayashi was born on January 11, 1933 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for The Castle of Cagliostro (1979), Lupin the 3rd (1977) and Daitokai - Tatakai no hibi (1976).
biography.name: Kiyoshi Kobayashi

biography.bio: David Matranga was born on April 20, 1975 in Houston, Texas, USA as David Anthony Matranga. He is known for his work on Starship Troopers: Invasion (2012), Journey to Agartha (2011) and Grave of the Fireflies (1988).
biography.name: David Matranga

biography.bio: Haruma Miura is a Japanese actor and singer. He is part of the Amuse agency, and debuted as one of the members of Brash Brats, a J-pop group. However, they are on hiatus, while Haruma is still active as an actor. He gained popularity with Gokusen 3 and 2007 film Koizora. He starred for the first time with a leading role in drama based on manga, Bloody Monday. He was cast in the movie Negative Happy Chainsaw Edge starring Hayato Ichihara. In 2008, he starred opposite Juri Ueno in Naoko and won the Sponichi Grand Prix Newcomer Award in the 63rd Mainichi Film Awards in 2009 for his role. He also was given a newcomer award in the 31st Japan Academy Awards on February 15, 2008. Miura soon gained recognition following several dramas such as Fight. During this time, Brash Brats went on hiatus, while Miura continued his acting career.
biography.name: Haruma Miura

biography.bio: Toshiyuki Morikawa was born on January 26, 1967 in Kawasaki, Japan. He is an actor, known for Berserk (1997), Naruto: Shippûden (2007) and Inuyasha (2000).
biography.name: Toshiyuki Morikawa

biography.bio: Both feared and revered, The Reverend Rob Mungle has been a staple of the stand-up comedy world since the early 1990s, when his brazen style and foul language caught the attention of comedy fans everywhere. He has remained in his native Houston for most of his life, helming the comedy scene there with an iron fist. His near-bloody conflicts with the IRS, anime fans, and strip-club managers have become the stuff of legend. Lately, he is best known for his anime voice-over work, notably in "Super Milk-Chan."
biography.name: Rob Mungle

biography.bio: Emily Neves was born on July 29, 1982 in Conroe, Texas, USA as Emily Marie Neves. She is an actress, known for Journey to Agartha (2011), Grave of the Fireflies (1988) and Starship Troopers: Invasion (2012). She was previously married to Andrew Love.
biography.name: Emily Neves

biography.bio: Shun Oguri was born on December 26, 1982 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and director, known for Crows Zero (2007), Crows Zero II (2009) and Rainbow: Nishakubou no shichinin (2010). He has been married to Yû Yamada since March 14, 2012.
biography.name: Shun Oguri

biography.bio: Chikao Ohtsuka was born on July 5, 1929 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for One Piece (1999), Fist of the North Star (1986) and Sherlock Hound (1984). He died on January 15, 2015 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Chikao Ohtsuka

biography.bio: Maaya Sakamoto was born on March 31, 1980 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children (2005), Ghost in the Shell (1995) and Ouran High School Host Club (2006). She has been married to Ken'ichi Suzumura since August 8, 2011.
biography.name: Maaya Sakamoto

biography.bio: Miyuki Sawashiro was born on June 2, 1985 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Hunter x Hunter (2011), Tegamibachi (2009) and Appleseed Ex Machina (2007).
biography.name: Miyuki Sawashiro
